Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for database size, performance, scalability, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use the Azure SQL Database.
Design the database architecture, including the choice of service tier, compute size, and storage requirements. Plan for high availability and disaster recovery.
Create the Azure SQL Database instance in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Select the appropriate service tier and configure initial settings.
Set up firewall rules to allow access to the Azure SQL Database from specific IP addresses or Azure services.
Enable security features such as Transparent Data Encryption (TDE), Advanced Threat Protection, and Always Encrypted for sensitive data.

Tasks.Task: Set Up Backup and Restore Policies
Tasks.Task Description: Configure automated backups and define retention policies. Test the restore process to ensure data recovery capabilities.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and SQL Analytics. Configure alerts for performance metrics, availability, and security events.
Analyze query performance and configure indexes, partitioning, and other optimization techniques. Use tools like Query Performance Insights.
Document the database architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Include details on security settings, backup policies, and monitoring setup.
Ensure the database setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement auditing features to track database activities and changes.
Simulate failover scenarios to ensure high availability and disaster recovery configurations are functioning as expected.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing, monitoring, and troubleshooting the Azure SQL Database setup.
